Message.Title: Mayer To Repair Search and Email, Focus On Products
Message.Msg: Mayer announced yesterday that she will focus on Yahoo products. Mayer could end the current search deal with Microsoft or at least renegotiate more favorable terms for Yahoo in the failed search partnership with Microsoft. Mayer will also repair Yahoo's aging emaill service while focusing on social and mobile initiatives.

Message.Title: Marissa Mayer begins makeover at Yahoo
Message.Msg: Yahoo Inc.'s new CEO, Marissa Mayer, has begun talking with product leaders about how to revive the company's search and email services, the Wall Street Journal reports. The former Google Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOG) executive has told employees she wants Yahoo (NASDAQ: YHOO) to develop or acquire Web services that take advantage of social networking, mobile devices and location services. The report notes she has also had the company's stock ticker removed from the home page of Yahoo's internal website, with the notion that employees should focus on their work rather than on corporate finances.

Message.Msg: More executive changes have been announced at Yahoo! (NASDAQ:YHOO). Michel Protti, who served as chief of staff for the departed interim Chief Executive Ross Levinsohn, is said to have exited the company. This will end up being a positive with professionals that don't trade in the after-hour markets.

Message.Title: Stock linger sub $16 after Alibaba plan was announced
Message.Msg: "Yahoo previously said it would sell up to half of its 40% stake in Alibaba, a Chinese e-commerce company, for $7.1 billion, including $6.3 billion in cash and about $800 million in Alibaba preferred stock. The deal would net Yahoo $4.2 billion after taxes. Yahoo originally said it planned to return “substantially all” of that to shareholders." Because the plan does not add value to YHOO operation and cash generation. Now Marissa wants to deploy cash to increase operation performance and generate returns rather than distribute $4.2 Billion cash and gets nothing for YHOO valuation. = Positive for Yahoo stock.

Topic.Title: Stupid AH trading--Time to buy is Now

Message.Msg: I agree except for the fact that I'm already loaded up. If Marissa is successful, she will probably use the cash to grow Yahoo and shareholders will benefit in the future. But, the fear of her not being able to pull that off is what is scaring everybody right now. Am I holding dead money today and for how long? The inflow of cash should increase the valley of Yahoo, even without a distribution. A sizable dividend would have decreased the pps from the price after receipt of the cash. It's all going to depend what investors think about what Marissa is capable of and what actions she does take. I'm sure that Loeb will be on board with any decision made for that cash. That is somewhat comforting today, especially after my idiotic move of selling Nvidia to buy Yahoo. Good luck to longs, especially me!

Topic.Title: Levinson ...

Message.Msg: BS, no doubt there are PLENTY of positive ways to use the cash and she knows, and understands, that. Buying back shares does not do anything to address the issues on the table. No doubt the shots have jumped on this from the get go but the dust will settle and we will move on. Loeb sees BIG rewards, longer term, not the nickel and dimes..

Topic.Title: What will Marissa and Loeb do with $4.3 billion+ $2 in cash

Message.Msg: She'll buy back stock, just like they've always planned to do. This is just a cynical ploy to deflate the price of YHOO shares, so they can do it as cheaply as possible. It's obvious and it's working like a charm. All the suckers are selling low.

Topic.Title: Alibaba $

Message.Msg: The money would be better invested as a share buy back (value plus increase in pps). There may be a plan to do something exciting with the money????? I will hold off on my opinion until I find out what the actual plan is. But, I would rather have them invest the money than pay it to shareholders in cash.

Topic.Title: Until Marissa prove her ability to revamp YHOO w jump in revenue

Message.Msg: that is why investors are dumping. Yahoo has $2 bn already enough for Marissa to play doll house with, but no, she wants to see how big of a doll house she can build with $4 bn more? she is out of her mind. Has she even done M&A before?? This how it is going to play out, she overspends for some acquisition, year or two later, they go bust and someone else picks up the fire sale - investors aren't going to wait for that nightmare scenario to happen. They are not going to wait for Marissa to blow away good money, because worst she can do is get fired and keep $70 million package, so there is no risks for her to take big risks with yahoo's pending cash horde and that is not what you want to see from an investor. Give money back to shareholders and play with what you've got is the message.

Message.Title: Let's have a wager
Message.Msg: How long will this one last? My guess is she won't come back after her maternity leave.

Message.Title: Yahoo has a new stock symbol
Message.Msg: Now listed as Yaboob on the little board. This stock is a bust.

Message.Title: Smart move for Marissa is not a smart move for yahoo..
Message.Msg: I have to say, it was brilliant move by Marissa. She is guaranteed $70 million - that is like having a "bernanke put" - she gets that dough no matter what. And she is also rich from Google tenure. But to make the hundreds of millions, to go sailing into the bright lights, she has to take risks, but what so good about it for her is that she ins't risking her stake, she is risking yahoo's money. Fantastic move. Why not take a free spin on the roulette with all the chips from yahoo on black and hope she can hit the lotto with one or two acquisitions. At worst case if it blows up in her face (which is likely scenario) she gets fired and keeps $70 million but if she gets lucky and it works out, she will be one minted lady... There is no risks for her, just gamble with yahoo's money. Smart move Marissa, you are looking out for number one, yourself. Yeah, screw the shareholders.
